title: Laws for Grain Offerings
summary: Leviticus 2 details the grain offering, a voluntary act of worship and thankfulness. It included fine flour, oil, and frankincense, and a portion was given to the priests.

faq.question: What was the grain offering?
faq.answer: An offering of flour, oil, and incense presented to God as a gift of thanks and worship.

faq.question: Was yeast or honey allowed?
faq.answer: No, yeast and honey were forbidden, but salt was required in every offering.
